summary: This document contains faxed legal correspondence from January 11, 2006, regarding the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein. It includes a memo from attorney Michael Salnick rescheduling a meeting with his client Janusz (Yanush) Banasiak, and a letter from Epstein's attorney Guy Fronstin notifying the State Attorney's office that Epstein will be paying the legal fees for his house manager Banasiak's attorney.

persons.name: Michael Salnick
persons.context: Attorney representing Janusz Banasiak, Epstein's house manager. He writes a memo rescheduling a meeting with the State Attorney's office and requests a copy of a subpoena.

persons.name: Janusz Banasiak
persons.context: Also referred to as Yanush Banasiak. He is Jeffrey Epstein's house manager who was asked to speak with the State Attorney's office and retained Michael Salnick as his attorney.

persons.name: Guy P. Fronstin
persons.context: Attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein. He writes a letter to the Assistant State Attorney notifying them that Epstein will be paying the attorney fees for Banasiak's legal representation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation. His attorney, Guy Fronstin, states Epstein will pay the legal fees for his house manager Janusz Banasiak's attorney.

persons.name: Jack K. Fuchs
persons.context: Listed as a lawyer at the law firm Salnick & Fuchs, P.A. on the letterhead. Mentioned in the document header.

persons.name: Flynn P. Bernath
persons.context: Listed as a lawyer at the law firm Salnick & Fuchs, P.A. on the letterhead. Mentioned in the document header.

persons.name: Jennifer L Shand
persons.context: Listed as a 'Canned Legal Natant' (likely 'Certified Legal Assistant') on the law firm's letterhead. Mentioned in the document header.

connections.description: Epstein is identified as the employer and Banasiak as his house manager.
Fronstin explicitly states "I represent Mr. Jeff Epstein."
Salnick's memo confirms Banasiak as his client, and Fronstin's letter states Banasiak retained Salnick.
Epstein is arranging to pay Salnick's attorney fees for representing Banasiak, creating a third-party payment structure.
Fronstin corresponds with Salnick (cc'd on letter) regarding the representation and fee payment for their respective clients.

events.title: Scheduled Statement of Janusz Banasiak
events.description: Banasiak was scheduled to give a statement to the State Attorney's office at 1:30 p.m. regarding the Jeffrey Epstein matter.

events.title: Banasiak Retains Michael Salnick
events.description: Janusz Banasiak met with and retained attorney Michael Salnick to represent him for his meeting with the State Attorney's office.

events.title: Rescheduled Meeting
events.description: Michael Salnick reschedules the meeting with his client Janusz Banasiak and the State Attorney's office to 11:00 a.m.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's house manager, Janusz (Yanush) Banasiak, was being questioned by the State Attorney's office in January 2006 as part of the Epstein investigation.

Epstein's attorney, Guy Fronstin, formally notified the State Attorney that Epstein would be paying the legal fees for Banasiak's attorney, Michael Salnick, creating a third-party payment arrangement.
The correspondence reveals early legal maneuvering in the Epstein case, with attorneys coordinating statements and fee payments for a key staff witness.
The document is subject to a protective order, indicating its sensitive nature within the investigation.
